stx.test.Runner

type
class
The Runner class performs a set of tests. The tests can be added using add or addFixtures. Once all the tests are register they are axecuted on the run() call. Note that Runner does not provide any visual output. To visualize the test results use one of the classes in the utest.ui package. Tests can be filtered both by class, by adding a filter funcion at the end of an addAll and by either a prefix as the second parameter of add / addAll or a regular expression as the third parameter. Asynchronous tests can be performed by importing stx.test.Assert and using Assert.createAsync for a handler that takes no parameters, or Assert.createEvent for a handler that takes one parameter. Once this handler is called the test is considered complete.

Constructor

new()
Instantiates a Runner onject.

Instance Variables

length(default,null) : Int

The number of fixtures registered.

onComplete(default,null) : Dispatcher<Runner>

Event object that monitors when the runner ends. This event takes into account async calls performed during the tests.

onProgress(default,null) : Dispatcher<{ totals : Int, result : TestResult, done : Int}>

Event object that monitors the progress of the runner.

onStart(default,null) : Dispatcher<Runner>

Event object that monitors when the runner starts.

Instance Methods

add(test : Dynamic, ?prefix : String, ?pattern : EReg) : Runner

parameters
test: must be a not null object
prefix: prefix for methods that are tests (defaults to "test")
pattern: a regular expression that discriminates the names of test functions; when set, the prefix parameter is meaningless
Adds a new test case.

addAll(tests : Iterable<Dynamic>, ?prefix : String, ?pattern : EReg) : Runner

addFixture(fixture : TestFixture<Dynamic>) : Runner

addFixtures(fixtures : Iterable<TestFixture<Dynamic>>) : Runner

getFixture(index : Int) : TestFixture<Dynamic>

run() : Runner
